rules.natural: If the park visitor center serves beer, then alcohol is permitted in the camping area.
Either the park visitor center serves beer or the visitor center is open.
Whenever headquarters mandated compliance, then if the park manager issued a directive, it follows that if the no-alcohol rule is enforced, alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.
Under the condition that the regional director approved the policy, headquarters mandated compliance.
Either a public protest occurred regarding the regulation or the regional director approved the policy.
Political pressure was applied against the ban, or it is not the case that a public protest occurred regarding the regulation.
Either the no-alcohol rule is enforced or a nature tour is provided as an alternative activity.
Provided that a nature tour is provided as an alternative activity, alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.
Whenever ranger patrols occur in the camping area, then if the no-alcohol rule is enforced, alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.
If a no-alcohol notice is posted on signage, then if the no-alcohol rule is enforced, alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.
Under the condition that a ranger is assigned to patrol duty, ranger patrols occur in the camping area.
Either a ranger is assigned to patrol duty or maintenance is assigned to post signs.
If maintenance is assigned to post signs, then a no-alcohol notice is posted on signage.
Provided that a supervisor ordered enforcement, if the no-alcohol rule is enforced, then alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.
Either a supervisor ordered enforcement or the park manager issued a directive.

facts.natural: Political pressure applied against the ban is not the case.

target.natural: The park visitor center is open.

steps.natural: Either ranger patrols occur in the camping area or a no-alcohol notice is posted on signage.
If the no-alcohol rule is enforced, then alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.
Alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.

(A10 → (A3 → ¬A2)).natural: Provided that the park manager issued a directive, if the no-alcohol rule is enforced, then alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.

(A3 → ¬A2).natural: If the no-alcohol rule is enforced, then alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.

(A4 → ¬A2).natural: Provided that a nature tour is provided as an alternative activity, alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.

(A5 → (A3 → ¬A2)).natural: Whenever ranger patrols occur in the camping area, then if the no-alcohol rule is enforced, alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.

(A7 → A5).natural: Under the condition that a ranger is assigned to patrol duty, ranger patrols occur in the camping area.

(A7 ∨ A8).natural: Either a ranger is assigned to patrol duty or maintenance is assigned to post signs.

(A8 → A6).natural: If maintenance is assigned to post signs, then a no-alcohol notice is posted on signage.

(A9 → (A3 → ¬A2)).natural: Provided that a supervisor ordered enforcement, if the no-alcohol rule is enforced, then alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.
